Description: The SEC announced enforcement actions against 23 firms for short selling violations as the agency increased its focus on preventing firms from improperly participating in public stock offerings after selling short those same stocks.  Such violations typically result in illicit profits for the firms.

Private Litigation Case Title: Anderson v. Principal Life Insurance Company et al

Description: The Principal Financial Group agreed to pay $5 million in settlement of allegations it secretly paid compensation to brokers to ensure access to pension plan insurance contracts.
$16,150 fine levied and ordered to refund $8,675.04 in overcharges plus 8% interest to 323 subscribers for using rates not in accordance with its approved filings. RCW 48.19.010(2); RCW 48.19.430.
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Info Source: PRINCIPAL LIFE PAYS $100,000 FINE LEVIED IN WASHINGTON STATE, BestWire, December 11, 2000 (via Nexis).

Description: violations of New York Insurance disclosure and suitability regulations in deferred to immediate annuity replacement transactions
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Principla Life agreed to pay a $1,997,866 fine in settlement of allegations the company had multiple non-compliant Disclosure Statements and failed to provide correct or required information to customers.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
